{{Day}} It is frequently the day of the [[autumn]]al [[equinox]] in the [[Northern Hemisphere]] and the day of the [[Spring (season)|vernal]] equinox in the [[Southern Hemisphere]].

==Events==
*  [[66]] &ndash; [[Roman Emperor]] [[Nero]] creates the [[Roman legion|Legion]] [[Legio I Italica|I Italica]].
* [[904]] &ndash; The warlord [[Zhu Quanzhong]] kills [[Emperor Zhaozong of Tang|Emperor Zhaozong]], the penultimate emperor of the [[Tang Dynasty]], after seizing control of the imperial government.
*[[1236]] &ndash; The [[Lithuanians]] and [[Semigallians]] defeat the [[Livonian Brothers of the Sword]] in the [[Battle of Saule]].
*[[1499]] &ndash; [[Treaty of Basel (1499)|Treaty of Basel]]
*[[1586]] &ndash; [[Battle of Zutphen]]:  [[Spanish Empire|Spanish]] victory over the English and [[Dutch Republic|Dutch]].
*[[1598]] &ndash; English playwright [[Ben Jonson]] kills an actor in a duel and is indicted for [[manslaughter]].
*[[1692]] &ndash; The last [[Salem witch trials|people]] hanged for [[witchcraft]] in England's North American colonies takes place.
*[[1711]] &ndash; The [[Tuscarora War]] begins in present-day [[North Carolina]].
*[[1761]] &ndash; [[George III of the United Kingdom|George III]] and [[Charlotte of Mecklenburg-Strelitz]] are crowned King and Queen, respectively, of the [[Kingdom of Great Britain]].
*[[1776]] &ndash; [[Nathan Hale]] is hanged for spying during [[American Revolution]].
*[[1789]] &ndash; The office of [[United States Postmaster General]] is established.
*[[1789]] &ndash; [[Battle of Rymnik]] establishes [[Alexander Suvorov]] as a pre-eminent Russian military commander after his allied army defeat superior [[Ottoman Empire]] forces.
*[[1792]] &ndash; ''Primidi [[Vendémiaire]]'' of year 1 of the [[French Republican Calendar]] as the [[French First Republic]] comes into being.
*[[1823]] &ndash; [[Joseph Smith, Jr.]] states he found the [[Golden plates]] on this date after being directed by God through the [[Angel Moroni]] to the place where they were buried.
*[[1857]] &ndash; The Russian warship ''[[Lefort (ship)|Lefort]]'' capsizes and sinks during a storm in the [[Gulf of Finland]], killing all 826 aboard.
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[Slavery in the United States]]: a preliminary version of the [[Emancipation Proclamation]] is released.
*[[1866]] &ndash; [[Battle of Curupaity]] in the [[Paraguayan War]].
*[[1869]] &ndash; [[Richard Wagner]]'s opera ''[[Das Rheingold]]'' premieres in [[Munich]].
*[[1885]] &ndash; [[Lord Randolph Churchill]] makes a speech in [[Ulster]] in opposition to [[Home Rule]].
*[[1888]] &ndash; The first issue of ''[[National Geographic Magazine]]'' is published.
*[[1896]] &ndash; [[Queen Victoria]] surpasses her grandfather [[George III of the United Kingdom|King George III]] as the longest reigning monarch in British history.
*[[1908]] &ndash; The [[Bulgarian Declaration of Independence]] is proclaimed.
*[[1910]] &ndash; The [[Duke of York's Picture House]] opens in [[Brighton]], now the oldest continually operating [[Movie theater|cinema]] in Britain.
*[[1914]] &ndash; [[German Empire|German]] submarine [[SM U-9]] torpedoes and sinks the British cruisers, [[HMS Aboukir]], [[HMS Hogue]] and [[HMS Cressy]] on the [[Broad Fourteens]] off the [[Netherlands|Dutch]] coast with the loss of over 1,400 men.
*[[1919]] &ndash; The [[steel strike of 1919]], led by the [[Amalgamated Association of Iron and Steel Workers]], begins in [[Pennsylvania]] before spreading across the United States.
*[[1927]] &ndash; [[Jack Dempsey]] loses the "[[The Long Count Fight|Long Count]]" [[boxing]] match to [[Gene Tunney]].
*[[1934]] &ndash; An [[Gresford disaster|explosion]] takes place at [[Gresford Colliery]] in Wales, leading to the deaths of 266 miners and rescuers.
*[[1937]] &ndash; [[Spanish Civil War]]: [[Peña Blanca]] is taken; the end of the [[Battle of El Mazuco]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; Joint [[victory parade]] of [[Wehrmacht]] and [[Red Army]] in [[Brest (Belarus)|Brest-Litovsk]] at the end of the [[Invasion of Poland]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; World War II: On [[Rosh Hashanah|Jewish New Year Day]], the [[Nazi Germany|German]] [[Schutzstaffel|SS]] murder 6,000 [[Jews]] in [[Vinnytsya]], [[Ukraine]]. Those are the survivors of the previous killings that took place a few days earlier in which about 24,000 [[Jews]] were executed.
*[[1955]] &ndash; In the United Kingdom, the television channel [[ITV (TV network)|ITV]] goes live for the first time.
*[[1957]] &ndash; In [[Haiti]], [[François Duvalier]] is elected president.
*[[1960]] &ndash; The [[Sudanese Republic]] is renamed [[Mali]] after the withdrawal of [[Senegal]] from the [[Mali Federation]].
*[[1965]] &ndash; The [[Indo-Pakistani War of 1965]] (also known as the Second Kashmir War) between India and Pakistan over [[Kashmir]], ends after the [[United Nations|UN]] calls for a [[cease-fire]].
*[[1975]] &ndash; [[Sara Jane Moore]] tries to assassinate U.S. President [[Gerald Ford]], but is foiled by [[Oliver Sipple]].
*[[1979]] &ndash; The [[Vela Incident]] (also known as the South Atlantic Flash) is observed near [[Bouvet Island]], thought to be a [[nuclear weapons test]].
*[[1980]] &ndash; [[Iran–Iraq War|Iraq invades Iran]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; The [[Dead Sea Scrolls]] are made available to the public for the first time by the [[Huntington Library]].
*[[1993]] &ndash; A barge strikes a railroad bridge near [[Mobile, Alabama]], causing [[Big Bayou Canot train disaster|the deadliest train wreck]] in [[Amtrak]] history. 47 passengers are killed.
*[[1993]] &ndash; A [[Transair Georgian Airline Crash (22 September)|Transair Georgian Airlines]] [[Tupolev Tu-154|Tu-154]] is shot down by a missile in [[Sukhumi]], [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]].
*[[1994]] &ndash;  [[Friends]], an American sitcom television show, debuts.  
*[[1995]] &ndash; An E-3B [[E-3 Sentry|AWACS]] crashes outside [[Elmendorf Air Force Base]], Alaska after multiple [[bird strike]]s to two of the four engines soon after takeoff; all 24 on board are killed.
*[[1995]] &ndash; [[Nagerkovil school bombing]], is carried out by [[Sri Lankan Air Force]] in which at least 34 die, most of them ethnic [[Tamil people|Tamil]] school children.
*[[2013]] &ndash; At least 75 people are killed in a [[Peshawar church attack|suicide bombing]] at a [[All Saints Church, Peshawar|church]] in [[Peshawar]], [[Pakistan]].
